contentrichtext.text: [[File:Taizokai.jpg|thumb|right|228px|The ''[[Garbhadhatu]]'' [[mandala]]. The center square represents the young stage of [[Vairocana]] Buddha. He is surrounded by eight [[Buddharupa|Buddhas]] and [[bodhisattva]]s (clockwise from top: [[Ratnasambhava]], [[Samantabhadra]], Samkusumitaraja, [[Manjusri]], [[Amitabha]], [[Avalokitesvara]], [[Amoghasiddhi]], [[Maitreya]])]] In [[Vajrayana]] Buddhism, the '''Womb Realm''' ([[Sanskrit|Skt]]. ''garbhakosa-dhatu'', {{lang-ja|胎蔵界}} ''taizōkai'') is the metaphysical space inhabited by the [[Five Wisdom Kings]]. The Womb Realm is based on the [[Mahavairocana Sutra|Mahāvairocana Sutra]]. The name of the mandala derives from chapter 2 of the sutra, where it is said that [[Vairocana|Mahāvairocana]] Buddha revealed the mandala's secret teachings to his disciple [[Vajrasattva]] from his "womb of compassion".<ref>{{cite book | last = Abe | first = Ryuichi | title = The Weaving of Mantra: Kukai and the Construction of Esoteric Buddhist Discourse | publisher = Columbia University Press | year = 1999 | isbn = 0-231-11286-6}}</ref> In other translations, the term ''matrix realm'' or Matrix Mandala are used.<ref>{{cite book | last = Hakeda | first = Yoshito S. | title = Kūkai and His Major Works | publisher = Columbia University Press | year = 1972 | isbn = 0-231-05933-7 | pages=26}}</ref> The Womb Realm is a very popular subject for [[mandala]]s, and along with the [[Diamond Realm]] (''vajradhatu'') Mandala forms the [[Mandala of the Two Realms]]. This mandala, along with the Diamond Realm, form the core of Japanese [[Shingon]] and [[Tendai]] Buddhist rituals, including the initiation or ''[[abhiseka]]'' ritual. In this ritual, new initiates are blindfolded and asked to toss a flower upon a mandala. Where the flower lands helps decide which Buddhist figure the student should devote themselves to.<ref>{{cite book | last = Hakeda | first = Yoshito S. | title = Kūkai and His Major Works | publisher = Columbia University Press | year = 1972 | isbn = 0-231-05933-7 | pages=44}}</ref> In traditional Shingon halls, the Womb Realm Mandala is hung on the east wall, symbolizing the young stage of [[Vairocana|Mahāvairocana]] Buddha.<ref>{{cite book| last = Hakeda | first = Yoshito S. | title = Kūkai and His Major Works | publisher = Columbia University Press | year = 1972 | isbn = 0-231-05933-7 | pages=87}}</ref>In this setting, the Diamond Realm Mandala is hung on the west wall symbolizing the final realization of Mahāvairocana Buddha. == Womb Realm map == <table border="1" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0"> <tr><td><center>Outside Vajra Hall</center> <table border="1" cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0"> <tr><td colspan="5"><center>Hall of Manjusri</center></td></tr> <tr><td rowspan="5">Hall of<br />Ksitigarbha</td><td colspan="3"><center>Hall of Shakyamuni</center></td><td rowspan="5">Hall of<br />Sarvanivarana-<br>Vishkambhin</td></tr> <tr><td rowspan="3">Lotus<br />Hall</td><td>Hall of Encompassing Knowledge</td><td rowspan="3">Hall of<br />Vajrapani</td></tr> <tr><td><br />Center<br />Eight Petal Hall</td></tr> <tr><td>Hall of the Wisdom Kings</td></tr> <tr><td colspan="3"><center>Hall of Akasagarbha</center></td></tr> <tr><td colspan="5"><center>Susiddhi Hall</center></td></tr> </table> </td></tr> </table> == See also == *[[Garbha]] *[[Dhatu]] *[[Diamond Realm|Vajradhatu]] == References == <references/> == External links == *[http://www.thangka.de/Gallery-3/Cosmos/9-6/antique.htm Mandala of the Womb World Japan, Kamakura period, 13th -
